member.name: T:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter
member.summary: SDK core used to initialize, start and control specific service.
SDK core used to initialize, start and control specific service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.Instance
member.summary: Gets or sets the shared instance of App Center. Should never return null. Setter is for testing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.SetCountryCode(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the two-letter ISO country code to send to the backend.
member.param: The two-letter ISO country code. See for more information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.SetWrapperSdk(Microsoft.AppCenter.WrapperSdk)
member.summary: A wrapper SDK can use this method to pass extra information to device properties.
member.param: Wrapper SDK information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.LogLevel
member.summary: This property controls the amount of logs emitted by the SDK.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.SetUserId(System.String)
member.summary: Set the custom user id.
member.param: Custom string to identify user. 256 characters or less.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.SdkVersion
member.summary: Get the current version of AppCenter SDK.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.IsEnabledAsync
member.summary: Check whether the SDK is enabled or not as a whole.
member.returns: A task with result being true if enabled, false if disabled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.SetEnabledAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable the SDK as a whole. Updating the state propagates the value to all services that have been started.
member.returns: A task to monitor the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.GetInstallIdAsync
member.summary: Get the unique installation identifier for this application installation on this device.
member.remarks: The identifier is lost if clearing application data or uninstalling application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.SetLogUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Change the base URL (scheme + authority + port only) used to communicate with the backend.
member.param: Base URL to use for server communication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.Configured
member.summary: Check whether SDK has already been configured or not.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.Configure(System.String)
member.summary: Configure the SDK. This may be called only once per application process lifetime.
member.param: A unique and secret key used to identify the application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.Start(System.Type[])
member.summary: Start services. This may be called only once per service per application process lifetime.
member.param: List of services to use.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.Start(System.String,System.Type[])
member.summary: Initialize the SDK with the list of services to start. This may be called only once per application process lifetime.
member.param: A unique and secret key used to identify the application.
List of services to use.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.SetCustomProperties(Microsoft.AppCenter.CustomProperties)
member.summary: Set the custom properties.
member.param: Custom properties object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.AppCenter.SetMaxStorageSizeAsync(System.Int64)
member.summary: Set the maximum size of the internal storage. This method must be called before App Center is started. This method is only intended for applications.
member.remarks: This only sets the maximum size of the database, but App Center modules might store additional data. The value passed to this method is not persisted on disk. The default maximum database size is 10485760 bytes (10 MiB).
member.param: Maximum size of the internal storage in bytes. This will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of a SQLite page size (default is 4096 bytes). Values below 20,480 bytes (20 KiB) will be ignored.
member.returns: true if changing the size was successful.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Http.HttpNetworkAdapter.SendRequestAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously makes an HTTP request.
member.param: The request message
Cancellation token
member.returns: Task containing the HTTP response

When tracking an analytics session, logs can be part of the session by specifying this identifier. This attribute is optional, a missing value means the session tracking is disabled (like when using only error reporting feature). Concrete types like StartSessionLog or PageLog are always part of a session and always include this identifier.
Custom property changes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.StartServiceLog
member.summary: Log type for sending information about which services have been started

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the StartServiceLog class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.StartServiceLog.#ctor(Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.Device,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.Guid},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the StartServiceLog class.
member.param: Log timestamp, example: '2017-03-13T18:05:42Z'.

When tracking an analytics session, logs can be part of the session by specifying this identifier. This attribute is optional, a missing value means the session tracking is disabled (like when using only error reporting feature). Concrete types like StartSessionLog or PageLog are always part of a session and always include this identifier.
The list of services of the MobileCenter Start API call.

member.summary: Gets or sets the list of services of the MobileCenter Start API call.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.StartServiceLog.Validate
member.summary: Validate the object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.Device
member.summary: Device characteristics.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.Device.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Device class.
Initializes a new instance of the Device class.
member.param: Name of the SDK. Consists of the name of the SDK and the platform, e.g. "mobilecenter.ios", "hockeysdk.android".
Version of the SDK in semver format, e.g. "1.2.0" or "0.12.3-alpha.1".
OS name (example: iOS). The following OS names are standardized (non-exclusive): Android, iOS, macOS, tvOS, Windows.
OS version (example: 9.3.0).
Language code (example: en-US).
The offset in minutes from UTC for the device time zone, including daylight savings time.
Application version name, e.g. 1.1.0
The app's build number, e.g. 42.

Version of the wrapper SDK in semver format. When the SDK is embedding another base SDK (for example Xamarin.Android wraps Android), the Xamarin specific version is populated into this field while sdkVersion refers to the original Android SDK.
Name of the wrapper SDK. Consists of the name of the SDK and the wrapper platform, e.g. "mobilecenter.xamarin", "hockeysdk.cordova".
Device model (example: iPad2,3).
Device manufacturer (example: HTC).
OS build code (example: LMY47X).
API level when applicable like in Android (example: 15).
Screen size of the device in pixels (example: 640x480).
Carrier name (for mobile devices).
Carrier country code (for mobile devices).
The bundle identifier, package identifier, or namespace, depending on what the individual plattforms use, .e.g com.microsoft.example.
Label that is used to identify application code 'version' released via Live Update beacon running on device
Identifier of environment that current application release belongs to, deployment key then maps to environment like Production, Staging.
Hash of all files (ReactNative or Cordova) deployed to device via LiveUpdate beacon. Helps identify the Release version on device or need to download updates in future.
Version of the wrapper technology framework (Xamarin runtime version or ReactNative or Cordova etc...). See wrappersdkname to see if this version refers to Xamarin or ReactNative or other.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.Device.SdkName
member.summary: Gets or sets name of the SDK. Consists of the name of the SDK and the platform, e.g. "mobilecenter.ios", "hockeysdk.android".

member.name: P:Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.Device.SdkVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets version of the SDK in semver format, e.g. "1.2.0" or "0.12.3-alpha.1".

member.name: P:Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.Device.WrapperSdkVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets version of the wrapper SDK in semver format. When the SDK is embedding another base SDK (for example Xamarin.Android wraps Android), the Xamarin specific version is populated into this field while sdkVersion refers to the original Android SDK.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.Device.WrapperSdkName
member.summary: Gets or sets name of the wrapper SDK. Consists of the name of the SDK and the wrapper platform, e.g. "mobilecenter.xamarin", "hockeysdk.cordova".

member.summary: Gets or sets OS version (example: 9.3.0).

member.summary: Gets or sets OS build code (example: LMY47X).

member.summary: Gets or sets screen size of the device in pixels (example: 640x480).

member.name: T:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorageAdapter
member.summary: Interface to work with database storage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorageAdapter.Initialize(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize this storage adapter.
member.param: Path of a database file to connect to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorageAdapter.CreateTable(System.String,System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Create table in database.
member.param: Name of a table to create.
Array with columns' names.
Array with columns' type descriptions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorageAdapter.Count(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns amount of rows matching given criteria.
member.param: Name of a table to run query on.
Column to match value by.
Value to match in a query.
member.returns: Amount of rows matching given criteria.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorageAdapter.Select(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Object[],System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String[])
member.summary: Returns collection of columns with values matching given criteria.
member.param: Name of a table to run query on.
Name of a column to match value.
Value to match in a query.
Column name to match excluded values by.
Excluded values to match in query.
Maximum amount of items to select.
List of a column names to order selection result ascending.
member.returns: Item list with array of objects. Array of objects is object[] representation of columns.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorageAdapter.Insert(System.String,System.String[],System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.Object[]})
member.summary: Inserts data to table.
member.param: Name of a table to run query on.
Array of columns used to insert data.
ICollection of columns with values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorageAdapter.Delete(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Deletes rows matching given criteria.
member.param: Name of a table to run query on.
Name of column to match value by.
Array of values to match in a query.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorageAdapter.SetMaxStorageSize(System.Int64)
member.summary: Set the maximum size of the storage.
member.remarks: This only sets the maximum size of the database, but App Center modules might store additional data. The value passed to this method is not persisted on disk. The default maximum database size is 10485760 bytes (10 MiB).
member.param: Maximum size of the storage in bytes. This will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of a SQLite page size (default is 4096 bytes). Values below 20,480 bytes (20 KiB) will be ignored.
member.returns: true if changing the size was successful.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorageAdapter.GetMaxStorageSize
member.summary: Gets the maximum size of the database.
member.returns: The maximum size of database in bytes.

member.summary: Asynchronously adds a log to storage
member.param: The name of the channel associated with the log
The log to add

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorage.DeleteLogs(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously deletes all logs in a particular batch
member.param: The name of the channel associated with the batch
The batch identifier

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorage.DeleteLogs(System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously deletes all logs for a particular channel
member.param: Name of the channel to delete logs for

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorage.CountLogsAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously counts the number of logs stored for a particular channel
member.param: The name of the channel to count logs for
member.returns: The number of logs found in storage

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorage.ClearPendingLogState(System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously clears the stored state of logs that have been retrieved

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorage.GetLogsAsync(System.String,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.AppCenter.Ingestion.Models.Log})
member.summary: Asynchronously retrieves logs from storage and flags them to avoid duplicate retrievals on subsequent calls
member.param: Name of the channel to retrieve logs from
The maximum number of logs to retrieve
A list to which the retrieved logs will be added
member.returns: A batch ID for the set of returned logs; null if no logs are found

member.name: M:Microsoft.AppCenter.Storage.IStorage.WaitOperationsAsync(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits for any running storage operations to complete.
member.param: The maximum amount of time to wait for remaining tasks
member.returns: True if remaining tasks completed in time; false otherwise

member.summary: Waits for any running storage operations to complete and prevents subsequent storage operations from running

member.returns: True if remaining tasks completed in time; false otherwise

member.summary: Set the maximum size of the storage.
member.remarks: This only sets the maximum size of the database, but App Center modules might store additional data. The value passed to this method is not persisted on disk. The default maximum database size is 10485760 bytes (10 MiB).
member.param: Maximum size of the storage in bytes. This will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of a SQLite page size (default is 4096 bytes). Values below 20,480 bytes (20 KiB) will be ignored.
member.returns: true if changing the size was successful.

member.summary: SDK emits all possible level of logs.

member.summary: SDK emits info, warn, error, and assert logs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AppCenter.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: SDK error and assert logs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AppCenter.LogLevel.Assert
member.summary: Only assert logs are emitted by SDK.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AppCenter.LogLevel.None

member.summary: Called by the SystemEvents class when our display settings are changing. We cache screen information and at this point we must invalidate our cache.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.Screen.OnUserPreferenceChanged(System.Object,Microsoft.Win32.UserPreferenceChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Called by the SystemEvents class when our display settings have changed. Here, we increment a static counter that Screen instances can check against to invalidate their cache.

member.name: M:Interop.Gdi32.CreateDC(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.remarks: Use when finished with the returned DC. Calling with ("DISPLAY", null, null, IntPtr.Zero) will retrieve a DC for the entire desktop.

member.name: T:Interop.BOOL
member.summary: Blittable version of Windows BOOL type. It is convenient in situations where manual marshalling is required, or to avoid overhead of regular bool marshalling.
member.remarks: Some Windows APIs return arbitrary integer values although the return type is defined as BOOL. It is best to never compare BOOL to TRUE. Always use bResult != BOOL.FALSE or bResult == BOOL.FALSE .
